Vignets Interface¶

class epyk.interfaces.components.CompVignets.Vignets(context)¶
block(recordSet=None, color=None, border='auto', width=300, 'px', height=None, 'px', helper=None, options=None, profile=None)¶

Every HTML element has a default display value depending on what type of element it is. The two display values are: block and inline.

Usage:

rptObj.ui.vignets.block({"text": 'This is a brand new python framework', "title": 'New Python Web Framework',
                       "button": {"text": 'Get Started', 'url': "/getStarted"}, 'color': 'green'})

Underlying HTML Objects:

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlTextComp.BlockText

Related Pages:

https://www.w3schools.com/htmL/html_blocks.asp

Parameters

  • recordSet –

  • color – Optional. The font color in the component. Default inherit

  • border –

  • width – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component width and its unit

  • height – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component height and its unit

  • helper – Optional. A tooltip helper

  • profile – Optional. A flag to set the component performance storage

bubble(recordSet=None, width=50, 'px', height=110, 'px', color=None, background_color=None, helper=None, profile=None)¶

The bubbles event property returns a Boolean value that indicates whether or not an event is a bubbling event. Event bubbling directs an event to its intended target, it works like this: A button is clicked and the event is directed to the button If an event handler is set for that object, the event is triggered If no event handler is set for that object, the event bubbles up (like a bubble in water) to the objects parent The event bubbles up from parent to parent until it is handled, or until it reaches the document object.

Usage:

rptObj.ui.vignets.bubble({"value": 23, "title": "Title"}, helper="This is a helper")

Underlying HTML Objects:

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlText.Text

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlContainer.Div

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlLinks.ExternalLink

Related Pages:

https://www.w3schools.com/jsref/event_bubbles.asp

Parameters

  • recordSet –

  • width – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component width and its unit

  • height – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component height and its unit

  • color – Optional. The font color in the component. Default inherit

  • background_color –

  • helper – Optional. A tooltip helper

  • profile – Optional. A flag to set the component performance storage

number(number, label='', width=100, 'px', height=None, 'px', profile=None, options=None)¶

The <input type=”number”> defines a field for entering a number. Use the following attributes to specify restrictions: max - specifies the maximum value allowed min - specifies the minimum value allowed step - specifies the legal number intervals value - Specifies the default value

Usage:

number = rptObj.ui.vignets.number(500, "Test")
number_2 = rptObj.ui.vignets.number(500, "Test 2 ", options={"url": "http://www.google.fr"})
number.span.add_icon(rptObj.ui.icons.get.ICON_ENVELOPE)

Underlying HTML Objects:

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlTextComp.Number

Related Pages:

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_input_type_number.asp

Parameters

  • number –

  • label –

  • width –

  • height –

  • profile –

text(recordSet=None, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', align='center', helper=None, options=None, profile=None)¶

Usage:

rptObj.ui.vignets.text({"title": "New Python Framework", 'value': "A new Python Web Framework", 'color': 'green',
                      'icon': 'fab fa-python', 'colorTitle': 'darkgreen'})

Underlying HTML Objects:

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlTextComp.TextWithBorder

Parameters

  • recordSet –

  • width – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component width and its unit

  • height – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component height and its unit

  • align –

  • helper – Optional. A tooltip helper

  • profile – Optional. A flag to set the component performance storage
